channel.title: Portal Requirements
channel.description: Ok so my current portal to frost dragons require 92 slayer and 85 minning how do i remove that requirement and change that to needing a requirment of combat 130

item.title: Portal Requirements
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“I am beast, post:13, topic:415249”][quote author=Kozs link=topic=517208.msg3756349#msg3756349 date=1316480163]

case 11356: if((c.combatLevel[1] < 130)) { c.sendMessage("You need 130 combat to kill Frost Dragons"); } else { if((c.combatLevel[1] > 130)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3052, 9577, 0); c.sendMessage("A nervous chill runs down your spine.."); c.sendMessage("you find yourself in the Frost Dragons Lair!"); } } } }

Replace Case 11356 with the code above.
[/quote]

Or this kid fails at life? lol jkjk. He just added two extra closing brackets that didn’t need to be there. Super simple fix.

Here is what it should be.

case ####: if((c.combatLevel[1] < 130)) { c.sendMessage("You need 130 combat to kill Frost Dragons"); } else { if((c.combatLevel[1] > 130)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3052, 9577, 0); c.sendMessage("A nervous chill runs down your spine.."); c.sendMessage("you find yourself in the Frost Dragons Lair!"); } }

The #### obviously being the portal ID.[/quote]

Thanks but I helped him over T.V using my code. He just forgot to delete a bracket from before.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Requirements
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:6, topic:415249”] case 11356: if((c.combatLevel[1] < 130)) { c.sendMessage("You need 130 combat to kill Frost Dragons"); } else { if((c.combatLevel[1] > 130)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3052, 9577, 0); c.sendMessage("A nervous chill runs down your spine.."); c.sendMessage("you find yourself in the Frost Dragons Lair!"); } } } }

Replace Case 11356 with the code above.[/quote]

Or this kid fails at life? lol jkjk. He just added two extra closing brackets that didn’t need to be there. Super simple fix.

Here is what it should be.

case ####: if((c.combatLevel[1] < 130)) { c.sendMessage("You need 130 combat to kill Frost Dragons"); } else { if((c.combatLevel[1] > 130)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3052, 9577, 0); c.sendMessage("A nervous chill runs down your spine.."); c.sendMessage("you find yourself in the Frost Dragons Lair!"); } }

The #### obviously being the portal ID.

item.title: Portal Requirements
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

OR, you could download Notepad++ OR Eclipse and find the starting bracket that containts the whole class after the imports and click right next to it and see what bracket is cutting it off from the end bracket at the end of the class… Derp

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Requirements
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Check your brackets… 100 errors is usually caused from a missing bracket >.<

XD darn bracket errors, but he is right, if you get 100 errors, just go to the top of the errors, find the line # of the first error, and check around that area for a missing bracket, to save us from having to t.v you and it just saves trouble for everyone

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Requirements
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

Go into ActionHandler and

case 11356: if((c.combatLevel[NO IDEA WHAT TO ADD?] < 130)) { c.sendMessage("You need 130 combat to kill Frost Dragons"); } else { if((c.combatLevel[STILL NO IDEA :)] > 130)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(3052, 9577, 0); c.sendMessage("A nervous chill runs down your spine.."); c.sendMessage("you find yourself in the Frost Dragons Lair!"); } } } }

I hope this helps… I haven’t tested but maybe this will get you on the correct track?
